subject: Politics
title: The Arab Spring
description: A quick win: understand The Arab Spring.

hook.text: In 2011, millions marched across the Arab world demanding freedom. Most ended up with more war, not more democracy.

buildup.text: Decades of dictatorship, corruption, youth unemployment, and repression had built pressure across the Middle East.

discovery.text: Tunisia overthrew its dictator and became a democracy. Egypt followed â€” then the military took power back.

twist.text: Syria's uprising became a civil war that killed 500,000 people. Libya collapsed into a failed state.

climax.text: Only Tunisia achieved lasting democracy â€” and even that has since backslid. Revolution doesn't guarantee progress.

punchline.text: The Arab Spring proved change is easy to start and hard to sustain.

quiz.question: Which Arab Spring country achieved lasting democracy, at least temporarily?
